title: 104_hr3885
content: SECTION 1. INFORMATION MADE AVAILABLE IN ELECTRONIC FORMAT AND INDEXATION OF RECORDS. Section 552(a)(2) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include provisions for indicating deletions in records made available or published. Additionally, it requires indicating deletions in the record itself if technically feasible. Copies of all records, regardless of form or format, must be provided. The amendment to Section 552(a)(2) of title 5, United States Code requires agencies to provide copies of records released to individuals and create a general index of these records. Agencies must make the index available electronically by December 31, 1999. Additionally, records created on or after November 1, 1996, must be made available by computer telecommunications within one year. The amendment requires agencies to provide records released to individuals and create a general index, available electronically by December 31, 1999. Records created on or after November 1, 1996, must be accessible by computer or other electronic means. The amendment requires agencies to provide records released to individuals and create a general index, available electronically by December 31, 1999. Records created on or after November 1, 1996, must be accessible by computer or other electronic means. SEC. 2. REPORT TO THE CONGRESS. Section 552(e) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to require agencies to submit an annual report to the Attorney General detailing the number of determinations not to comply with records requests, appeals made, and statutes relied upon to withhold information. The annual report required by Section 552(e) of title 5, United States Code, must include details such as the number of pending requests, processing times, fees collected, and estimated time to comply with different types of requests. Each agency must report the number of staff and expenses related to processing records requests. The reports must be made available to the public electronically, and the Attorney General will consolidate them for easy access. The Attorney General must also inform relevant congressional committees by April 1 each year. The Attorney General, in consultation with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, must develop reporting guidelines by October 1, 1997. An annual report must be submitted by April 1 of each year, detailing the number of cases, exemptions, dispositions, and associated costs under this section. The report should also outline the Department of Justice's efforts in this regard. The Department of Justice is working to ensure agency compliance with reporting guidelines.
